ratings.comment: Marko requires a lot of work from his students but the work is truly helpful in understanding the material.  The exams were not all that hard and he is very fair with the curve and also allowing corrections on certain problems.  He made himself very available in office hours and was always willing to answer any questions I had.

Marko was not a great instructor and made the material overly complicated. Exams required quite a stretch of your knowledge with weird word problems and prompts. Exams were hard to study for because lectures were not organized and the review problems he provided never came with solutions. Too many exams for amount of material covered.

This was the hardest class I have ever taken. I completely understood the topics that he taught and said that would be on the tests, but then he just twists it and makes the tests literally impossible. I am a very good student and I did not get over a D on any of his tests. If you care about your GPA, don't take this class with Marko..

Worst teacher I've ever had. He is knowledgeable but has no grasp of instructing whatsoever. He is very rude and unhelpful. I once asked a question of him, and he laughed in my face that I did not know the answer to it. His written homework assignments are the hardest math problems I've completed in my life and not relevant to class.

This class was honestly the hardest class I have ever taken. Marko is a really nice guy but not a good teacher at all. He means well but is so bad at explaining the material. He is incredibly smart but makes even the simplest concepts impossible to understand because he isn't able to dumb it down for the class to understand. I would not take agin.

Team homework - Annoying but interesting. Individual homework - difficult, but good system. Tests - ridiculously hard, but fairly curved. Extra credit - quite a bit of it, take advantage of it.  Marko overall - Cares about your performance, if you attend class and participate you will succeed. I would take another class with him.

Marko is awesome. The class is tough but not too bad. I actually finished with an AB but Marko bumped me to an A after I inquired and he saw my attendance from the class. He's a great teacher that keeps Calculus about as interesting as he can. The tests were tough but he curves the class enough to make it manageable. Team homeworks were annoying.

Listen, here is the real honest deal wit this guy.  People were freaking out about how hard the final was, which it was.  That being said, Marko is a solid professor who does in fact care about us learning.  While the final was ridiculous, he still clearly curved the class fairly, and gave ample opportunities to make up for test with extra credit

Simple, basic lectures. Unhelpful TAs for discussion. Tedious homework (that doesn't correlate with lectures). Entirely irrelevant and unnecessary team homework. Comically difficult exams. I found his dismissive attitude and unprepared lecture style to be flat-out rude. The fact that my tuition paid for a part of this man's salary makes me sad.
Marko is a great teacher, he asks a lot of his student, but if you try in his class he will ensure that your grade reflects that effort.

I didn't care for the class, but don't think Marko deserves all of the low marks below.  The class and exams were too difficult, but he certainly didn't take any joy in students struggling.  He made himself available outside of office hours, which is good because I needed the extra help.  Definitely one of the toughest finals I've taken.

Just took the final, and it was by far the most difficult test I have had on campus thus far. I did not see a need for it to be so difficult; it really didn't test our knowledge of the material we were supposed to learn. Take 213 with a different professor, if you can.

I understand the criticism here about he made an intro level calc class for non-math majors pretty much the hardest thing we've all taken.  However, I do not think Marko was a bad professor.  I think he over-shot a lot of the topics and definitely made the exams WAY too complicated.  Wouldn't recommend for 213, but would for a higher level class.

The toughest class i have ever taken at UW. Marko gives test that are significantly more difficult than anything you have seen in hw or reviews.  Lectures are long and boring. Large amounts of hw every week, both individual and group work. Would not recommend the class.

Not the right person to be teaching an intermediate level non-major math class. Struggled to keep my attention and was not well-informed enough to be teaching a business math class. FInal was the hardest test I've taken in a while and contained a lot of material that was not gone over and a ton of trig (not taught in the prerequisite 211).

Very tough class. Marko's Math 213 was more like a high level calc course for math majors than a 200 level class for business majors. I appreciate that he wanted students to have a really theoretical, deep understanding of the material, but the class was unnecessarily confusinghard.

I regret every day that I took this course. Some people are not meant to be teachers and Marko is one of them. He did not care about us succeeding, and consequently made succeeding basically impossible if you weren't a mathematic savant. Please don't take this course with him. Tests were so irrelevant. The whole class is irrelevant.

This professor clearly loves the power of failing people. He obviously wants to show that math has an application, but does not know how to relation to business (i.e. he makes up stupid word problems). He pretends to not understand what a 'curve' is even when the average is a D. Do NOT take this class.

Looked at some practice exams from previous semester for a diff. professor.... Wow, we all got cheated pretty bad.  His exams are impossible and he told us he was  "pleased" that the class average was a D.  Hope he never teaches this class again.

Math 213 A.K.A. the hour and 15 minutes where I got a nap in.  This guy is so incredibly boring you might as well bring a pillow to class or just skip and save yourself the trouble.  Dosn't teach anything in class that is relevant, the exam was entirely things we NEVER learned.  He LOVES to see students fail!!

Unhelpful. Unclear. Tough grader... expects WAY too much from a 200-level math class.  Don't bother going to class or taking the HW too seriously... none of it will even show up on the exams.  He tries to "invent" word problems but they just end up confusing what could be straight-forward calc topics.  Just overall bad, bad, calc professor.

He is the worst math professor I have ever had. He makes you write math papers, which do not help your understanding on the subject, and his review packets for his exams are way more difficult than the material presented in the homework and lectures.

Worst math professor i've ever had.  Tries (and fails) at teaching because he goes WAY too much in detail about how you should understand the "applications".  Class is HEAVILY aimed at business students, which is a shame for non-business students who want to learn CALCULUS.  Take with a diff. prof is you want a good grade in this class.

Don't understand all the criticism here. Class was not particularly tough and the exam was pretty straight-forward. Solo homeworks were easy but the team homeworks were definitely a drag. Lecture was boring some days, tolerable the others. All-in-all, Marko wasn't great and wasn't that bad.

Really tough professor. Lectures are awful to sit through. Team homeworks are a waste of time. Makes you write a term paper which is absolutely pointless for a math class. Tried to teach the depth of concepts during lectures, but would be way more beneficial if he actually taught the numbers and applying equations (better examples).

Tough material.  Appreciated going over problems with him in office hours, and he answered questions over email if I couldn't make it during office hours.  You had to work for your grade, but he was willing to help.

Professor seemed a little disinterested in the material, and tried to "spice" it up for business students but that using entailed over complicating simple concepts. Problems from the book were not the ones shown on the exams, and i felt like readings never matched up with lectures.  Exams highly application oriented and not really any thing taught.

Dosn't know how to teach! If you have to take this class, at least save yourself the annoyance of his ridiculously irrelevant and off-topic lectures and teach yourself.  Really difficult grader AND don't expect to get any higher than a D on the exams, he purposely makes them impossible.  Avoid this prof!!
He is one of the worst professors I've ever had. It is quite clear that he doesn't care about teaching lower level courses and was hired here to do research.
Great professor, ,relaxing lectures, down to the earth.  He gave me a lot of helpful advice on math path.
Great professor, down to earth. He is very helpful and would like to talk to you beyond what's covered in class. Ask him questions if you have any, they will be answered!

Lectures were pretty standard, though he sometimes tried to mix things up with visuals, applications, and MATLAB stuff. Homeworks were frequent and very difficult, but exams were extremely easy. As a result, getting an A wasn't too difficult. He's very willing to help during office hours. Recommended overall.

Marko is a pretty laid back guy and lectures quite well. Some of his homework problems are rough and punishing at times but if you at the very least understand how to do the homework, you'll do fine on the exam. The exams are fair and not as nuts as some of the homework computations. He is also helpful at office hours for specific questions.

Very good Prof. Probably the best I had so far. Homeworks are a bit hard and often unclear what they are asking you but tests are reasonable. Office hours are a must, and so are lectures. Its his first time in Madison, but he's far better than some of the veteran profs. I know
Decent professor. Grading on homework was a little unclear though.
